pros: The faculty is great, I learn a lot by just talking to them
cons: Very busy during the semester - 60 hour weeks.

review_title: Stop gap for your next job
job_title: Assistant Football Coach in Sherman, TX
pros: Good staff to work within the athletic dept
cons: Not a lot of pay, overloaded with work

pros: Not much positivity at AC
cons: Too much work for no compensation. Admin and execs pile more work for no additional compensation. No appreciation for the extra work either.

pros: Great Place to work amazing people to work with! Benefits Amazing
cons: Extremely under staffed hard to do everything with little help

pros: Good entry level experience, something to float you to get somewhere else. Good benefits.
cons: Pay is below national average. They ask staff to do multiple jobs.

review_title: Decent work study; little work for little pay.
job_title: Library Circulation Worker in Sherman, TX
pros: It is a very relaxed environment with flexible hours and a very light work load.
cons: Position only open to students as work study financial aid. Minimum wage.

pros: made some money during school
cons: made bad money bad hours

review_title: Passionate people but a lot of red tape
pros:
-Faculty are excellent, and working with students is marvelous.
-Lots of opportunities for personal hobbies and interests.
-Work is varied but not overly taxing day to day.
cons:
-Staff and faculty do not mix at all; they are treated as separate "classes."
-Some departments are extremely poorly run and good luck to you if you end up in one of them. They are all talk and no fixing. 
-Moral can get very low.
-Internal politics are an absolute mess. 
-Staff are underpaid and overworked. Insufficient precautions are taken during hazardous weather, forcing staff to come in (or take a day off) while faculty can cancel class. This has resulted in several broken bones/car accidents.

job_title: Assistant Director of Admissions in Sherman, TX
pros: nice coworkers, excellent faculty the issue lies in the staff (non professors) however this is an excellent school to attend just do not work here
cons: lack of communication, unprofessional environment, poor pay, high turnover rate

review_title: Great People, but Management does not treat customers well
job_title: Work Study Student in Sherman, TX
pros: Very good people. Experts at their jobs. I love the atmosphere. I learned a lot and never felt too stressed. Supervisors are very understanding and coworkers are fun.
cons: Management does not treat it's customers well. They change their policies regarding customers and but continue to do business with Aramark, who constantly screws them over. They don't have to deal with the customers so we end up having to put up with problems that could easily fixed by management.

pros:
Not many employees, so you get to know a large percentage of them.
Students are very bright.
Nice small campus - don't have to walk far from parking lot.
Comfortable student center.
Cheap area to live in.
cons:
Since it is so small, not many opportunities to do something else, unless you are faculty.
Sherman is not a exciting place.

pros: Flexibility in work hours, meaning that you can choose the hours when you are at the office.  You still need to do prep work and grading, but you can do it outside the office.
cons: No upward mobility.  Once you become Full Prof., you need to committee work and go to meetings where much is discussed but not much implemented.

pros: It was a wonderful place to work as a part of my work study. It allowed me the opportunity to see how the library sciences worked, see what it means to work in a team, and to build my communication skills. The bosses here are understanding and fair - they truly make sure you have a wonderful experience here!
cons: None I can think of.

job_title: Student Life ­ Resident Assistant in Sherman, TX
pros: A positive environment, lots of opportunities, and a good chance to get a feel for different jobs. Hours were very flexible
cons: The pay was only minimum wage, and no benefits were offered. However still a good work environment

pros: not much, maybe the time off?
cons: work life balance is horrible, Senior Leadership has not idea how staff is truly treated or they ignore it, management in general is horrible

pros: Other faculty are outstanding, dedicated, collegial
cons: Upper management destroying the institution

pros: The people are very friendly.
cons: The management is flaky.  Decisions are made with no future plans made.

review_title: The students are wonderful to work with.
pros: Students are bright and want to give back.
